bioghist.p: Chester Garfield Fisher founded Fisher Scientific in 1900 at the age of 20. C. G. Fisher was first drawn to alchemical artworks because they included beautifully rendered depictions of laboratory apparatuses. He began acquiring alchemical paintings in the 1920s and continued to collect alchemical artworks throughout his lifetime. In the 1920s Fisher began collecting paintings and artifacts that depict the history of chemistry. Fisher was fascinated by the work of Louis Pasteur, and he constructed a special Pasteur room, dedicated to the great French biologist that contained apparatus, instruments, and other original documents.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains 43 of the images and documents from the Fisher Collection's Pasteur room, including sketches, framed letters, photographs and prints.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
